definition: to weep/to howl as if at a funeral
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: Her cry, liking howl at a funeral, is unpleasant to the ear.
sentences.chinese: 这个人哭起来真难听，象号丧一样。

definition: to cry out loud without tears
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to wail at a funeral/formal wailing while offering sacrifice to the departed
to raise one's voice/to speak at the top of one's voice
lit. cries of grief shake the heavens/great sorrow (idiom)
the cat weeps for the dead mouse (idiom); hypocritical pretence of condolence/crocodile tears
